project.teaser: Batteries Europe Secretariat (BEST) proposal aims to enrich, strengthen and extend the key role of Batteries Europe by gathering academia, industry and research expertise within the Secretariat to consolidate the Battery R&I community and assist the existing platform in the...
project.objective: Batteries Europe Secretariat (BEST) proposal aims to enrich, strengthen and extend the key role of Batteries Europe by gathering academia, industry and research expertise within the Secretariat to consolidate the Battery R&I community and assist the existing platform in the achievement of their ambitious goals. BEST consortium will engage in its experts working groups industry stakeholders, academia, policy makers, researchers and citizens from all the value chain, especially broadening involvement on underrepresented domains and countries. BEST will contribute to gain synergies among battery R&I stakeholders’ landscape, consolidate the workflow among the initiatives, facilitate free and inclusive access to information, strength industry-research collaboration to push technology developments to reduce time to market of new solutions, reinforce European talent attraction capacity and provide fact-based orientations to policy makers. The Secretariat will gather expertise to develop Strategic R&I agenda, design updated roadmaps, establish KPIs per application (transport, stationary, portable, etc.) to nurture the SET Plan, contribute to standards and reporting methodologies harmonization, promote education on battery fields and rise social awareness. The Secretariat will organize workshops per objectives, complemented with experts’ interviews, discussion forums, scientific papers review, etc. to confront current state of the art with future trends, considering international tendencies. BEST is formed by 11 partners and 4 affiliated entities, led by Innonergy, with ZABALA, CLERENS SINTEF, VDI/VDE INNOVATION, CICenergiGUNE INSTM (UNIMIB, UNIPV, POLITO), EERA, EASE and ENEA. The partners are promoters of main European initiatives related to batteries that has facilitated the establishment of collaboration flows to bring Batteries Europe Platform to next stage in 36 months, with a budget of 2.999.889 €.
project.title: Batteries Europe Secretariat
project.keywords: Batteries technologies, Energy storage, European Batteries value chain , Batteries research and innovation communities, Electrification

article.title: A new secretariat to energise Batteries Europe

result.title: Ensuring accurate Key Performance Indicators for Battery applications by implementing consistent Reporting Methodologies

details.authors: Ivana Hasa, Stefano Passerini, Kristina Edstrom, Philippe Stevens, Alessandro Romanello, Roberto Scipioni, Edel Sheridan

result.title: Guidelines on common reporting methodology
result.description: The aim of this deliverable is to develop a document with a set of clear guidelines regarding reporting of results within battery research projects which will result in improved communication and clarity. The document is to be based on the reporting methodologies produced by Batteries Europe in 2021. Broader stakeholder consultation will be undertaken via online workshops, firstly within Batteries Europe WGs and to the broader batteries community and also to the international community via work with the editors of popular high quality peer review journals. Close collaboration with the Battery 2030+ initiative will examine the workability of the reporting guidelines in active projects and will modify accordingly.

result.title: Overview of international R&D&I Funding and international Benchmarks for KPIs
result.description: Illustration of main activities in building battery innovation systems and contrasting European and international perspectives, based on direct exchange with Governments and relevant international R&D&I actors, as well as mapping of international roadmaps on batteries.

result.title: Delivery of the European Strategic Research & Innovation Agenda II
result.description: The aim of these deliverables (2 reiterations) is to create and deliver a concise, clear SRIA document which clearly identifies the key Research and Innovation needs be addressed and KPI which must be met, in order to support the advancement of a competitive, sustainable European battery industry taking in to account the entire battery value chain. The SRIA is to be produced as a collaborative work combining input from each of the WG and TFs with a consolidating approach across all stakeholder groups of Batteries Europe. It is expect the SRIA will be used by European, national and regional stakeholders from public organizations, industry and research providers when developing their research programs and strategy relating to the battery ecosystem.

result.title: KPIs Benchmarking & Target KPIs III
result.description: The scope of this deliverable is to define set of KPIs per application (stationary, transport, portable, etc.) to define the SoA baseline and propose target KPIs that could fed the SET Plan progress monitoring process.

result.title: Project Management Plan
result.description: The project management plan will describe how the project is executed monitored and controlled including Gantt chart Work Breakdown StructureIt will also include the Batteries Europe Work Plans and Yearly activities reports

result.title: R&I Roadmaps & Roadmaps revision II
result.description: The aim of this deliverable is to create and deliver d concise, clear updated/ new Research and Innovation Battery Roadmaps with the purpose to detail new Research and Innovation actions needed with corresponding KPI targets, in all the areas of the battery value chain from raw materials through to application as indicated by the 6 Working Groups.

result.title: R&I Roadmaps & Roadmaps revision I
result.description: The aim of this deliverable is to create and deliver d concise, clear updated/ new Research and Innovation Battery Roadmaps with the purpose to detail new Research and Innovation actions needed with corresponding KPI targets, in all the areas of the battery value chain from raw materials through to application as indicated by the 6 Working Groups.

result.title: Batteries Europe video
result.description: The video aims to communicate the role of the project in accelerating the deployment of batteries in Europe It presents the scope of the project its main objectives stakeholders involved and the most important elements in its development This report is related to task 61

result.title: Batteries Europe Governance Term of References
result.description: A ToR document will be prepared for each Governance Body of the Platform, containing detailed nomination process of each member, their role, organisation, scope and follow-up.

result.title: Communication and dissemination report Y2
result.description: The communication activities reports will present the outcomes and results obtained in terms of communication and dissemination within BEST. Its periodicity also allows for reviews and adaptations of goals and activities if needed. The plan is the outcome of Task 6.1, but will get inputs from all other tasks to maximize the project’s impact.

result.title: KPIs Benchmarking & Target KPIs II
result.description: The scope of this deliverable is to define set of KPIs per application (stationary, transport, portable, etc.) to define the SoA baseline and propose target KPIs that could fed the SET Plan progress monitoring process.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - BEST (Batteries Europe Secretariat)

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Delivery of the European Strategic Research & Innovation Agenda I
result.description: The aim of these deliverables (2 reiterations) is to create and deliver a concise, clear SRIA document which clearly identifies the key Research and Innovation needs be addressed and KPI which must be met, in order to support the advancement of a competitive, sustainable European battery industry taking in to account the entire battery value chain. The SRIA is to be produced as a collaborative work combining input from each of the WG and TFs with a consolidating approach across all stakeholder groups of Batteries Europe. It is expect the SRIA will be used by European, national and regional stakeholders from public organizations, industry and research providers when developing their research programs and strategy relating to the battery ecosystem.

result.title: Final report on cross-cutting topics summarising the activities carried out and main results
result.description: A final document will be produced at the end of the project summarising the main activities carried out and results obtained in each of the cross-cutting task forces of the work package 4 (i.e., education, training and (international) mobility cooperation, digital solutions for digital batteries, Sustainability, Safety & Standards and SSH), such as workshops, consultations, indicators, and policy reports.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Plan describing the data management life cycle for the data that will be collected processed and generated by the BEST consortium It include also a chapter dedicated to the Open Research Data collected during the project

result.title: KPIs Benchmarking & Target KPIs I
result.description: The scope of this deliverable is to define set of KPIs per application (stationary, transport, portable, etc.) to define the SoA baseline and propose target KPIs that could fed the SET Plan progress monitoring process.

result.title: Communication and dissemination report Y1
result.description: The communication activities reports will present the outcomes and results obtained in terms of communication and dissemination within BEST. Its periodicity also allows for reviews and adaptations of goals and activities if needed. The plan is the outcome of Task 6.1, but will get inputs from all other tasks to maximize the project’s impact.

result.title: Communication and dissemination report Y3
result.description: The communication activities reports will present the outcomes and results obtained in terms of communication and dissemination within BEST. Its periodicity also allows for reviews and adaptations of goals and activities if needed. The plan is the outcome of Task 6.1, but will get inputs from all other tasks to maximize the project’s impact.

result.title: Project Management Plan update (2)
result.description: The project management plan review will contain the update about the project is executed, monitored and controlled, including Gantt chart, Work Breakdown Structure.It will also include the Batteries Europe Work Plans and Yearly activities reports.

result.title: Project Management Plan update (1)
result.description: The project management plan review will contain the update about the project is executed monitored and controlled including Gantt chart Work Breakdown StructureIt will also include the Batteries Europe Work Plans and Yearly activities reports

result.title: Position Paper on cross-cutting topics
result.description: A deliverable will be produced in M24 identifying the needs, challenges, and barriers that the battery community could face and providing clear and concise recommendations for the next 5-10 years for the battery community and policymakers in the five cross-cutting topics of the work package 4 (i.e., education, training and (international) mobility cooperation, digital solutions for digital batteries, Sustainability, Safety & Standards and SSH).

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
